discussion.content: I tested this on virtual devices - B is the correct answer

We can split the answer like this:
– if VLAN 1 is Native => C is incorrect => A or B => SW6 is the server, he will update all the others with the active VLANS: 1 to 101 => B

– if VLAN 1 is not Native => SW6 is the server, he will update all the others with the active VLANS: 1 to 101 => SW1 and SW4 will have all the vlans => no need to prune => B

Answer B (if answer A is correct => B is also true)

comments.content: So I think the answer is C.

discussion.content:
"With VTP versions 1 and 2, when you enable pruning on the VTP server, it is enabled for the entire VTP domain. In VTP version 3, you must manually enable pruning on each switch in the domain."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3750x_3560x/software/release/12-2_55_se/configuration/guide/3750xscg/swvtp.html#99689

Has to be B. The VP pruning command would be rejected on switches in client mode. If the other switches are configured the same as switch 4, then none of the could have enabled pruning. There's nothing to suggest pruning has been enabled on SW6, the VTP server, so no pruning will take place on the trunks between any switches. Due to the fact VLANs 1 to 101 are available on the SW6-SW5 links, VLANs 1 to 101 must be configured on SW6, the VTP server. These VLANs will be present on all client switches, so VLANs 1 to 101 must be forwarding on every trunk.
but they are VTP3, when pruning is configured on SW6 then the client inherit the setting, am i right? however, i think C is the correct answer.
You can only enable VTP pruning on a switch in VTP server mode. In the pic Its in client mode so Its not prunning

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. If switch SW6 is operating VTP Server and the other devices have the same configuration as SW4, which statement about the VLANs network is true?
//IMG//


SW4# show run | include vtp -
vtp mode client
vtp domain cisco
vtp domain ciscotest
vtp pruning
vtp version 3

choices.C: VLANs 1 through 9 are pruned on the link between SW1 and SW4.
choices.A: Traffic on VLANs 1 through 9 is flooded to all switches in the network.
choices.D: VLANs 1 through 101 are pruned on the link between SW1 and SW2.
choices.B: VLANs 1 through 101 are operational on all switch trunks.

questions.question_text: Which option is a CISCO recommended RSPAN configuration practice?

choices.C: Use a different RSPAN VLAN for each session if configuring RSPAN on multiple switches.
choices.B: Assign access ports to an RSPAN VLAN like any other campus VLAN.
choices.D: Use only one destination port for EACH RSPAN Session.
choices.A: Define RSPAN VLAN before configuring an RSPAN source and destination session.

discussion.content:
native-vlan 
Native VLAN TLV

Indicates the Inter-Switch Link (ISL) number of the native interface VLAN on which the Cisco Discovery Protocol packet is sent, as well as whether the VLAN is enabled on the link and whether the link is a trunk or a host/edge port.

vtp-mgmt-domain 
VTP Management Domain TLV

Specifies the name of the VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) management domain for a device running the VTP on the particular interface on which the Cisco Discovery Protocol packet is sent.

The length of this TLV determines the length of the VTP management domain name. A length of zero indicates that a device is running VTP but has no management domain name assigned to it.

questions.question_text: Which two pieces of information are carried in a Cisco Discovery Protocol advertisement? (Choose two.)

choices.C: The priority value of the HSRP group is 1.
choices.A: The exhibit hello and hold timer values are in use.
choices.E: The standby router can take the active HSRP role if it fails to receive a hello packet from the active router within 10 seconds.
choices.B: The standby router can take the active HSRP if it fails to receive a hello packet from the active router within 1.616 seconds.

discussion.content: the word "default" is probably missing in answer A

discussion.content:
According to IPHELPER dumps, the question is missing a fifth choice:
The configured VRRP priority of the interface is 120

Which two statements about the network environment of the interface that generated? (Choose two)
A. The configured VRRP priority of the interface is 120
B. The device on which the interface resides is acting as a standby router
C. The Skew time .531 seconds
D. The Configured VRRP Priority of the interface is 105
E. If the priority of another router is higher than the priority of the master router, it becomes the master router

Correct Answer: AC
I agree on 120 Priority. I also agree on D since its VRRP

comments.content:
The scew time: t = (256 - configured_priority)/256 = (256 -120)/256 ~ 0.531 sec
So you are right. 
Answers must be: Priority 120 (the answer is missed) and the skew time = 0.531

discussion.content: As master down interval is 3.531 sec, doesn't that make B correct too? "The Skew time .531 seconds"

The Configured VRRP Priority of the interface is 105 is incorrect.

Current is 105 after interface down (-15) so configured is 120

choices.A: The device on which the interface resides is acting as a standby router
choices.D: If the priority of another router is higher than the priority of the master router, it becomes the master router
choices.C: The Configured VRRP Priority of the interface is 105
